description: Increase of periods with lower river discharge
Low ground water levels and dry soils
Increase in food prices, more import
Less people venturing into crop and livestock production
Reduced  recharge into groundwater reservoirs, dried wells
Increased vulnerbility and economic hardship smallholder  farmers
More crime, drugtrafficking, disease, school drop-out
Drink water shortage for live stock
Yield increase of less sensitive  crops such as cassava, peas and groundnuts (CO2 fertilisation)
Yield decline of drought-sensitive crops such as maize and millet
More pollution in urban areas, pressure on resources
